Are you passionate about designing and maintaining modern, stable, and secure network solutions? If so, this might be the opportunity for you!
 



  





**About the Position** 




 As a Network Engineer with us, you will be responsible, together with the team, for ensuring that we always deliver stable and fast services to our customers. You will work on everything from capacity planning, designing architecture, and maintaining systems to exploring new technologies. You will also contribute to creating network services that our operations and development teams can use to securely and efficiently deliver new features to our customers. Additionally, you will provide the organization with expertise and advice on network issues and solutions.
 



  





 You will also work with:
 


* Cisco ACI, ISE, ASR, and Fortigate
* Management and development of existing network environments and solutions
* Troubleshooting incidents and problems
* Load balancing solutions and Firewalls



  





 You will be part of our Network team with 6 wonderful and competent colleagues who have high standards for keeping our technical environment modern and streamlined. Our network team is like a spider in the web, providing a central service/delivery to internal teams and colleagues as well as external partners. We are constantly exploring new modern technologies that can help us build an even better bank.
 



  





**Who We Are Looking For** 




 We are looking for someone who is a highly skilled technician and who is challenged by constantly making things more efficient and elegant. You are motivated by curiosity, are creative and engaged, and see teamwork as an obvious and natural part of achieving common success with your colleagues. We also see that you should be good at finding smart solutions and being able to explain them well to others. You are a good communicator who enjoys working according to agile methods.
 



  





 We prefer that you have:
 


* Several years of work experience in a similar network role
* Previous experience with load balancing and firewalls
* Experience with cloud networking, NX-OS, or SDN data center networks is a plus
* Proficiency in Swedish, both spoken and written



  





 To be successful in this role, we see that you should have good network knowledge in Cisco and/or Fortinet. It is advantageous if you have a CCNP certification and experience with load balancing. It is also a plus if you have previously worked with virtualization or container networking. Experience in coding, preferably with Ansible or Python, is also beneficial for the role. As a person, you have a strong technical interest and enjoy learning new things. You are passionate about quality, motivated by collaborating with colleagues, and enjoy sharing your expertise and experience.
 



  





**Application** 




 Submit your application by clicking on the "Apply now" button below the ad. Please send your application as soon as possible as selection is ongoing, but no later than 30/9. We do not accept applications via email due to GDPR. Please contact Björn Lindholm, Engineering Manager at bjorn.lindholm@avanza.se if you have any questions about the position.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!
 



  





 Offers from recruitment agencies/advertisers are kindly declined.

title: SEB in Stockholm looking for Penetration Testers
description:
**Join SEB´s new Offensive Security team in Stockholm as we establish and shape the Purple Teaming function!**
 SEB is looking for more Penetration Testers to pioneer our Offensive Security team. Your role involves conducting both internal and external penetration tests, collaborating closely with developers, security engineers, and incident responders to safeguard the SEB IT infrastructure and services. Additionally, you´ll be engaged in red team activities. This position offers the unique opportunity to influence and shape your approach to work right from the start.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**SEB Offers You**
* Agile and modern ways of working.
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.


**Your Challenge**
* Build and form the new purple teaming function together with our skilled security engineers
* Conduct internal and external penetration testing activities, including full stack exploitation, and leveraging of access within multiple environments, such as Windows or \*nix.
* Work closely with developers and engineers to analyze and understand the security posture of software products and infrastructure.
* Stay updated on emerging security threats and vulnerabilities.
* Support the development teams and infrastructure teams regarding cyber security.
* Design, lead and participate in targeted red team activities.
* Conduct scenario-based security testing & purple teaming to identify gaps in detection and response capabilities.


**The Team and Workplace**
 You will join the Operational Security Center that consists of Security Engineers, Incident Response Engineers, Vulnerability Managers, and Penetration Testers. We aim to be at the forefront of cybersecurity, penetration testing, and operational security assessments.
   

  

 SEB´s office is located in Solna, Stockholm and our office offers several restaurants, a gym with training classes and events throughout the year. The work is done according to a hybrid remote model.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for someone with a keen interest in cybersecurity and several years of experience as a penetration tester, where you have independently conducted penetration tests in Windows and Linux environments. You thrive in collaborative team environments and willingly share your knowledge and experiences. Furthermore, you have a broad interest in technology and excellent problem-solving skills. It´s a plus if you have experience in programming, infrastructure environments, application security, cloud security. OSCP/OSEP and other IT security-related certifications are a plus.
   

  

**Let´s Connect!**
 SEB has chosen to work with Ada Digital in this recruitment. Our recruitment process focuses on transparency, inclusion and a fast moving candidate experience. And now we want to know more about you – on your own terms! To apply, please fill out the short form, briefly motivate why you are interested in the position, and attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile. No additional documentation is needed. You can then, in real-time, follow your application online as our recruiters are working with it. We work with a continues selection process which means we might hire a candidate before the final apply date, so apply already today! Interested and want to know more? Please contact our recruiter today. We are looking forward to connecting soon!

title: We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Team!
description:
*Telenor Connexion is a leading, Scandinavian provider of IoT (Internet of Things) services with over 20 years of experience working with enterprises around the world.* 




  





*We are a global leader in connecting things and manage more than 20 million connections across the world for multinational customers such as Volvo, Scania, Hitachi, Verisure Securitas Direct and Husqvarna. We provide easy and reliable access to every market in the world and enable industry leading players to connect their products and services on a global scale across every vertical.* 




  





*Telenor Connexion is a specialized IoT company within the Telenor Group and together we rank among the top 3 IoT operators in Europe and among the top 10 in the world.* 
*With headquarters and tech center located in the Nordics, we have sales representation in the UK, US, Germany, Italy, South Africa, South Korea, China, Taiwan and Japan.* 




  





**The Position and the Team** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer with excellent capabilities in advanced and modern data processing of large volumes and velocity to join our team.
 



  





**In this position, you and the team are responsible for:** 




  




* Architecting and developing our data platform, which includes Fetching, processing, and preparing data – both batch and real-time data.
* Developing Analytics reports and tools.
* Develop and manage ML-models.
* Piloting and driving AI-use cases into production.
* The team also has a DevOps responsibility which in our case means that “what we build we also operate, and we take care of it”.



  





 The Data Team interacts and serves business value to almost every part of the organization. The team is also responsible for delivering direct customer value, either by supporting customer facing colleagues or via customer facing Data products. The team is highly advanced and has run production-workloads using Big Data technologies for more than 8 years and constantly innovates, improves, and iterates the solution. The platform processes 400 000 000 000 real-time events per year and is currently running several thousands of online Machine Learning models (in production).
 



  





 This is a great opportunity to become part of a mature and efficient data team, with a massive exposure to our global business. We are not afraid of taking things to production and have solid confidence that it will work and target the desired business value. And if not, the team pivots and changes its approach accordingly. We value a great team attitude, and it is important that the new team-member matches or complements our team culture and dynamics.
 



  





 This role reports to our Head of Data (Data Science and Analytics team) and is located in Stockholm, Karlskrona or Gothenburg.
 



  





  





**Required Experience and Skills** 




 To be successful in this position, you should have extensive experience and skills in advance use cases of:
 



  




* PySpark
* Pandas
* Athena/Trino
* Apache Iceberg
* AWS Glue
* AWS StepFunctions
* Apache Flink
* CI/CD design patterns.
* Python
* Java
* Data-oriented test-cases
* Reference Data management
* Distributed workloads including partitioning strategies.
* Scalable data processing patterns.



  





**Other requirements** 



* MSc in Software/Data Engineering or similar
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and preferably Swedish.
* Residence and work permit in Sweden



  





 We put strong emphasis on the experience of processing high and growing volume data usecases. For example, you should have been part of a team that faced scaling issues of your data processing task at least couple of times during your career. If your team solved it by moving to a larger instance, then we won’t be impressed. If throughput scaled linearly with your cluster scale-out, then you might be a good candidate. On the other hand, if you can give examples where your team’s redesigned solutions resulted in a lowering of cost per billion records processed – then you are likely an ideal candidate!
 



  





 Candidates should also be knowledgeable in secure design and access patterns, and preferably hold AWS Certificate or at least Associate level in any of the Data Engineer, Solution Architect or Developer domains.
 



  





**As a person** 




 We are looking for a committed and self-driven person with a positive and optimistic attitude. You are not afraid to take large responsibility. You are business-oriented and good with people. You love to share technical know-how and good practice. The team shares a test-driven approach and a common interest to work across several environments and programming languages, utilizing the powers of the cloud and we hope that this resonates with you too.
 



  





**Our Offer** 




  





 Telenor Connexion offers you
 
 a chance to be a part of one of the most interesting areas within the tech industry where the work we do has a huge impact on almost all areas in society. We are a fast-growing international company with great possibilities for your career ahead. Telenor Connexion is a flat and people-oriented organization with attractive job benefits where you have the opportunity to influence and build your role and make a real difference in building our brand.
 



  





**We are** 
 a team consisting of a diverse group of talented innovators, including platform developers, service engineers, data scientists and marketers. What unites us all is a dedication to providing our customers solutions and services that have a positive effect on businesses and communities.
 



  





**You will also have:** 



* Attractive and competitive bonus scheme
* Additional days off during the year
* Flexible and hybrid work policy
* Nice offices for collaborative work
* Training and development focused company
* Friendly work environment that recognizes each employee’s potential and value
* Talented and engaged colleagues all around the world.



  





  





**Application** 




 Ensure that your submitted CV includes relevant project references, your role, contribution to the delivery, and data volume in place. Please motivate in your application letter why you think you have the relevant advanced experience (or why you would be able to acquire it in a short period of time). We expect that every applicant is on a constant learning and development journey, and hence will be able to obtain potential lacking competences needed for the role during the employment. If this is the case, please be transparent in your application letter, so that expectations are reasonable.
 



  





 Finally, we would love to get to know
 **you** 
 in your personal letter, mentioning principles that is close to your heart, what you value in a work environment, what you like to talk about by the coffee machine, what you do off-work to re-charge or explore your other non-data related passions of life.
 



  





  





**Placement:** 
 Stockholm or Karlskrona
 



  





**Application and contact:** 
 Please apply through our recruitment system Workday.
 



  





 If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact Ander Bresell (Head of Data Engineering,
 
 anders.bresell@telenorconnexion.com
 




  





**Deadline:** 
 The closing date for applications is September 30th the latest. If you are interested, please apply as soon as possible as we will interview continuously. The position might be filled before the last application day.

title: Implementation Engineer, Jigsaw (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Jigsaw. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you a software consultant who has relied on LLMs to make life easier for most of your career? Are you afraid your hard skills will atrophy if you continue spending most of your day on low-skill tasks? Jigsaw is revolutionizing consulting by harnessing the power of AI to cut through the noise and let you focus on what truly matters: delivering high-impact results for clients. If you’re driven by innovation and want to be at the forefront of AI-enhanced project delivery, this role is tailor-made for you.
   

  

 Jigsaw is fundamentally rethinking how projects are delivered, using generative AI to automate the mundane and elevate the strategic. Say goodbye to the grind of manual configuration, which you are overqualified to do anyway, and hello to a world where AI does the heavy lifting, freeing you to focus on building systems and delivering unparalleled client service.
   

  

 This isn’t your average consulting gig. If you're looking to spend your days entrenched in manual tasks, this isn’t the job for you. Instead, we need someone who thrives on using AI to push boundaries, someone who relishes the challenge of aligning technology with client business goals. You’ll be advising on everything from survey design to panel creation, all while ensuring that the solutions you deliver are flawlessly aligned with client expectations.
   

  

 Join us if you’re excited by the idea of transforming the consulting landscape, if you want to leave behind the old ways and embrace a role where your strategic input has real, measurable impact. This is your chance to be part of a team that’s not just keeping up with the future of consulting but defining it. If that sounds like you, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* AI-Enhanced Project Delivery: Using generative AI to improve project delivery, customer communications, and validation of project deliverables.
* Consulting Services: Gathering and analyzing customer business requirements, advising on survey structure, best practices for panel creation, and training clients on the software platform.
* Configuration Services: Configuring surveys, panels, and data gathering processes within the software platform.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Manually reviewing every knowledge base article and Excel trackers
* Creating slide decks
* Traveling to client sites
* Coding or programming


**Implementation Engineer Key Responsibilities**
* 100% of clients achieve 100% of their business goals through AI-driven professional services engagements


**Basic Requirements**
* Must be based in the European Union, United Kingdom, or EEA
* At least 2 years of experience as a consultant delivering software implementation projects
* Professional experience demonstrating and configuring software
* Professional experience offloading work to generative AI tools and using AI to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements


**About Jigsaw**
 Delivered on a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform, Jigsaw’s virtual learning and collaboration technology enables our customers to revolutionize how they train, educate, collaborate and work through a virtual environment – helping them embrace digital transformation and enhance their organizations’ success.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5408-SE-Stockhol-Implementation1

title: Supporttekniker till Sveriges största statliga forskningsfinansiär!
description:
Vi söker nu en passionerad supporttekniker som vill arbeta på en arbetsplats som verkligen gör skillnad! Hos vår kund kommer du inte bara att lösa tekniska problem – du kommer också att vara en del av en organisation som ligger i framkant av svensk forskning och innovation. Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vill vara med och skapa förutsättningar för Sveriges forskningsframgångar, tveka inte att söka denna spännande tjänst som supporttekniker!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Kundtjänst
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vår kund är Sveriges största statliga forskningsfinansiär, en organisation som stödjer forskning av högsta kvalitet inom alla vetenskapsområden. Här arbetar du i hjärtat av forskningsvärlden, där banbrytande idéer föds och utvecklas. Du kommer att vara en viktig kugge i maskineriet som gör att forskningen kan fortsätta driva samhället framåt.
   

 Här blir du snabbt en självklar del av en inspirerande och dynamisk miljö, omgiven av engagerade kollegor som brinner för att forskning ska komma till nytta i samhället. Här värdesätts samarbete, men det finns även stort utrymme för självständigt arbete och personligt ansvar.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Chansen att vara med och stötta forskning som bidrar till samhällsutveckling.
  
* Arbeta i en miljö där teknik och vetenskap möts, och där ditt arbete gör skillnad.
  
* En utvecklande roll där ingen dag är den andra lik.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Självständigt lösa problem som första linjens supporttekniker.
  
* Administrera konton, behörigheter och hantera konton via AD Basic och Entra ID.
  
* Arbeta med grundläggande funktioner i M365 och Intune.
  
* Förbereda och underhålla datorer (Windows 10 och 11) samt mobila enheter (iPhone och Samsung).
  
* Hantera VPN-anslutningar och teknisk utrustning i konferensrum.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Tidigare arbetat i en liknande roll inom first line-support.
  
* Du är van vid att arbeta med fileshare och kan grunderna i system som används för att dela filer och information.
  
* Erfarenhet av Active Directory.
  
* Grundläggande kunskap om VPN.
  
* Erfarenhet av hantering och support inom Microsoft365 och Intune.
  
* Erfarenhet av teknik i konferensrum
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**
  
* Är lösningsorienterad och trivs med att arbeta självständigt, samtidigt som du vet när det är dags att eskalera ärenden till andra linjens support.
  
* Har ett starkt serviceinriktat mindset och förstår vikten av att hålla en hög servicenivå.
  
* Är van att arbeta i en varierande miljö och snabbt kan anpassa dig till nya tekniska utmaningar.
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106990

title: Account Manager
description:
We're thrilled that you're considering a career at Kindly! Here's everything you need to know about this job. 🥳
 



  





**About Kindly** 
 🟢
 



 Kindly is a growing tech company of 60+ employees, working out of Oslo, Stockholm, Copenhagen, and Amsterdam. We create chatbot solutions for businesses, particularly in the B2C sectors. We have over 150 incredible clients that include Norwegian Airlines, Voi, Booking.com, Kahoot!, TV4, and Tele2 – just to name a few. Our tech reaches over one million users every month and we handle thousands of messages every hour.
 



  





 We believe that one of the key factors for success in a job is enjoying your workplace. At Kindly, we all work towards common goals, and everyone wants the best for each other. We want you to have fun at work! That's why it's important for us that when we hire new people, they share this philosophy.
 



  





**About our team 👋** 




 We are fun and down-to-earth. We are a talented team that works hard to deliver exceptional products that we are proud of. We value curiosity and collaboration. Together, we're developing a platform that takes online user experience to the next level!
 



  





**What you'll do 📋** 




 As an
 **Account Manager** 
 , your job will be to:
 



  




* Own the commercial relationship of a set customer group in our portfolio
* Negotiate contracts, up-sell, and cross-sell within your portfolio
* Stay up-to-date with Kindly’s products and services
* Gain the necessary knowledge and understanding about the customers' market and the products or services they sell
* Analyse performance, identify value-creation opportunities and drive changes in your portfolio
* Collaborate with Customer Success and Customer Integration teams to deliver value to our customers



  





**We believe this is you🏌️** 



* You are used to handling complex international sales processes from start to closing
* Enthusiastic with a positive attitude and curious mindset
* Have a passion for Sales and building relationships
* You work well in teams, but also independently.
* It is important to have excellent communication skills, both oral and written, in a Scandinavian language, and English (a third language is a plus)
* You have 5+ years of experience in B2B sales within the SaaS industry.
* You are accustomed to working with decision-makers in larger companies from various industries in the Nordics and/or other European markets.
* You are self-driven and can get a lot done



  





**The Kindly Perks 🛍️** 



* Kindly offer a pleasant, inclusive, and creative workplace. We give our team responsibility and trust, along with the opportunity to shape their working day.
* Career opportunities that provide professional and personal development
* A significant degree of professional freedom, flexible work hours, and location
* Recognition of hard work and direct influence on our products
* Modern offices, situated in Oslo, Stockholm, Copenhagen, and Amsterdam
* Competitive salary and conditions
* Kindly Collective (mental well-being and representation)
* Personal Development Hours during work hours (6 hours per month)



  





 That's it for now.
 **Good luck** 
 with your application process.🤞

title: Senior DataOps Engineer
description:
Are you ready to elevate your career and become a part of a team that is transforming the way TRATON delivers exceptional software solutions to our customers? We are on the lookout for a Senior DataOps Engineer who is expert in data pipelines and enhancing data strategies to join our dynamic team. You will be working in a hybrid work-setting with exciting and complex software development!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We are dedicated to an inclusive and diverse workplace. You will join a diverse and competent team with a friendly, helpful and inclusive atmosphere. The team has a common vision of the goals and values, allowing us to take our jobs seriously while having fun at the same time. We care for each other’s personal development to learn, grow and evolve, in order to make our deliveries the best we can produce. Be yourself and reveal your talents!
   

  


**Your Role**
 In your role as a Senior DataOps Engineer, you are an essential contributor to our mission of establishing a world-class developer experience. You will scope, design, and implement developer experience focused on pipeline efficiency and infrastructure for a connected development loop inspired by Platform Engineering. The aim is to enable our engineers to validate and deploy their ideas within 24 hours of conception. Seize this opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on the industry!
   

  

 You will have the chance to contribute to our “developer platform” and “developer portal” initiatives. These elements are integral to any modern tech organization. You will collaborate with a skilled team to develop and sustain these vital components. You will also contribute to creating pipelines and supporting infrastructure to enable self-service workflows across these capabilities.
   

  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* You will work with DataOps in the whole chain from hardware to ML and LLM using modern approach and best practices to cater business needs for TRATON.
* You will create tools to aid in management and infrastructure of data.
* You will enhance the current pipelines and visualisation by integrating to the developer portal.
* You will encourage and improve knowledge sharing by working with peers from across the organization, sharing your experience, learning from others and contributing to our shared knowledge base.
* You will evaluate the performance of our solutions and seek ways to improve them.


  

  


**Qualifications**
* Programming experience in Python and scripting experience.
* Experience with containerization, Cloud Computing (AWS or Azure preferred), Kubernetes, Kafka and Graphana.
* Automation and orchestration experience including Terraform, Helm, GitLab CI, ArgoCD.
* Experience in setting up monitoring for infrastructure and applications with tools such as Prometheus, Datadog, OpenTelemetry.
* Experience in configuring and troubleshooting container environments.
* Experience in data driven development, preferably within the ML context.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


  

  

**Experience with the following is meritorious:**
* Developing pipelines for ML and LLM products.
* Working with Big data in an industrial context.
* Previous experience working with a data pipeline from distributed hardware to a central data store.
* Working collaboratively in an Agile/Scrum environment.


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**Further information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position please contact Mariette Annergren (Group Manager, EEDCD) at +46855353145.
   

  

 and Elvedin Ramic (Group Manager, EEDCE) +46855350687

title: Product Owner D2C Fulfilment
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people, and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together. Our company is present in 60 countries, selling in more than 150 markets. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 As Product Owner D2C Fulfilment you will be responsible for driving the development of our commercial fulfilment capabilities across EU and APAC. You will be part of the larger Direct Consumer Interaction (CDI) Experience organisation, working cross-functionally with product, engineering and business owners and managers. You are responsible for the execution of delivery plans within consumers orders, consumer promise and consumer logistics flow.
   

  

 The fulfilment area also includes warehouse processes and consumer return flows with the objective to optimize operations and secure great a consumer experience. The mission for D2C fulfilment is to launch consumer centric experiences that drives commercial growth in our D2C channel. You will be reporting to Product Manager D2C Fulfilment.
   

  

 The key objective for this role is to drive the execution of the development agenda by close collaboration with the engineering team and business stakeholders prioritising the business objectives and set targets. You will be collaborating in a global context with regional and local impact.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Collaboration with engineering team in scrum planning and agile ceremonies
* Align ongoing work, time plans, priorities and desired output with business stakeholder
* Set and mange plans and progress of initiatives and communicating this to internal stake holders
* Define, plan and prioritize epics


**Who you are:**
* Skilled communicator across departments and levels of the entire business and have exceptional prioritisation skills. You are a skilled translator of business targets into actionable digital product solutions. A data driven individual where the consumer’s perspective and experience is at highest priority. Thought digital product experience you apply agile development, identifying and specifying MVP’s based on consumer feedback creating automated, scalable solutions with continuous improvement. Furthermore we believe you have:
* 3+ year as digital product owner
* Solid experience in modern product management practices such as Scrum, Product Road mapping, product discovery and OKR’s.
* Strong understanding in digital product lifecycle, D2C fulfilment practices and high-level software architectures
* Experience from SAP (Commerce Cloud, ECC, SAP CP) & Atlassian (Jira & Confluence) is a plus
* Fluent in English with strong written and verbal communication skills


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based in Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.
   

  

**Find out more on:**
 ElectroluxGroup: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: IT Application Specialist till Linde Gas
description:
Linde Gas söker en stark problemlösare med passion för teknik som vill fortsätta utvecklas i rollen som Applikationsspecialist. Här en del av ett starkt team med hög kompetens och engagemang. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Linde Gas
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Applikationsspecialist på Linde Gas kommer du att ansvara för två plattformar, Accura och Linx. Accura är en egenutvecklad applikation som används av Lindes kunder, såsom sjukhus, för att hantera lager och beställningar. Linx är en handdatorapplikation för Lindes återförsäljare i syfte att hålla koll på lagerhållning. Du kommer att arbeta nära applikationsägare och externa partners för att underhålla och förbättra dessa system, samt säkerställa att de fungerar optimalt.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att arbeta på ett globalt företag med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter
  
* Stöd och utbildning för att utveckla din tekniska kompetens
  
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med engagerade och kunniga kollegor
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utföra underhåll, uppdatering och utveckling på plattformarna
  
* Ge kvalificerad systemteknisk support i samarbete med applikationsägare
  
* Arbeta direkt med applikationsägare för att förstå och hjälpa till att definiera nya applikationskrav
  
* Säkerställa lämplig kunskapsöverföring för applikationer som utvecklats med externa partners för att möjliggöra internt stöd
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant utbildningsbakgrund, troligtvis inom IT
  
* Har erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling, och gärna SAP-relaterad
  
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Java och Azure
  
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
* Har en bred teknisk bakgrund
  
* Har erfarenhet av att hantera leverantörer
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Stabil
  
* Ansvarstagande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Linde Gas**

 Linde är ett ledande globalt företag inom industrigaser och teknik. Linde lever efter sin mission att göra vår värld mer produktiv varje dag genom att tillhandahålla högkvalitativa lösningar, teknologier och tjänster som gör deras kunder mer framgångsrika och hjälper till att upprätthålla, avkarbonisera och skydda vår planet.
 


  


 Lindes industrigaser och teknologier används i otaliga applikationer, inklusive produktion av ren väte som är kritisk för energiomställningen, livräddande medicinsk syrgas och högrenade specialgaser för elektronik, bland annat. I över 50 år har Linde varit en global ledare inom väte och utnyttjar sin ingenjörskompetens, tillsammans med en betydande tillgångsbas och expertis, för att göra renare energi till verklighet världen över.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Linde Gas**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105985

title: Technical Solution Architect - Energy Intensive Industry
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you prepared to stretch the limits of your professional acumen and develop your excellence in an open, collaborative, and empowering culture? We are seeking a multidisciplinary, technically proven expert in crafting energy solutions for Energy Intensive Industries. Do you want to join an international team working on a wide range of exciting projects?
   

  

 If this sounds like you and curious to learn more, this opportunity role could be the perfect next career step for you. Join our Energy Transition department as our new Technical Solution Architect covering Energy Intensive Industries, and work with us to close the gap to a sustainable future.
   

  

**Your new role**
 As our new Technical Solution Architect, you will lead development of competitive sustainable Technical Solutions, and establish plans and strategies for Ramboll’s delivery model in collaboration with our Business Developers. You will take the lead in technical client dialogues of establishing Technical Scope for Client Solutions and outline Ramboll’s Deliverables.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will be:
   

  

  

* Advisory of Technical Solutions and best practice for clients in cooperation with Business Developers.
* Interpret and establish Technical Scope of work ensuring alignment with client requirements Ramboll standards, best practices, and in-house expertise.
* Establish high level overview of technical deliveries and roadmap for project execution.
* Take lead in the preparation of high-Level Customer CAPEX and Ramboll offerings in close cooperation with Ramboll’s experts.
* Facilitate technical scope and quality review sessions across project life cycle.
* Adopt Technological Innovations into solutions and quired and standardized concepts and methodologies where feasible.


**Your new team**
 As our Technical Solutions Architect in Energy Transition, you will be part of an exceptional technical environment with 650 passionate colleagues. Our team consists of multidisciplinary experts covering diverse sectors and technologies, such as Offshore Substations, Power to X, Gas Infrastructure, Bio & Power Generation and Energy Intensive Industries on a global scale within the energy sector.
   

  

 The transition to green energy is the organisation’s primary focus area. Our services cover the layout, design, and execution of large green energy solutions. We cover all aspects of a project including concept and feasibility studies, detailed engineering, EPC, and follow-up engineering.
   

  

**About You**
 From the moment you start at Ramboll, we will support your personal and professional development so that you can continue to grow with the company. Whilst we look forward to supporting your continued learning and development, for this role we have identified some qualifications, skills, and capabilities that will set you up for success.
   

  

 These include:
   

  

  

* A minimum of 15 years’ experience in Energy Solutions for Energy Intensive Industries, preferably with a multi-disciplinary engineering background as Engineering Manager or similar.
* Understand value engineering, interface management, risk minimisation, and synergies and interdependencies with Suppliers.
* High level understanding of gate delivery models for technical solutions and project execution.
* Must have excellent understanding of Technical Solutions and Industry Practices and act as an integrator. Has natural authority based on knowledge and experience.
* Ability to work in multicultural matrix environment and used to communicate with international technical experts.
* Demonstrates good communication skills and has commercial acumen.
* Understanding commercial risks and mitigations


**What We Can Offer You**
* Investment in your development
* Leaders you can count on, guided by our Leadership Principles
* Be valued for the unique person you are
* Never be short of inspiration from colleagues, clients, and projects
* The long-term thinking of a foundation-owned company


**Work at the heart of sustainable change**
 Ramboll is a global architecture, engineering, and consultancy company. We believe that the purpose of sustainable change is to create a thriving world for both nature and people. So, that’s where we start – and how we work. At Ramboll, our core strength is our people, and our history is rooted in a clear vision of how a responsible company should act. Being open and curious is a cornerstone of our culture. We embrace an inclusive mindset that looks for fresh, diverse, and innovative perspectives. We respect, embrace, and invite diversity in all forms to actively cultivate an environment where everyone can flourish and realise their full potential.
   

  

**Ready to join us?**
 Please submit your application. Be sure to include all relevant documents including your CV, cover letter, etc.
   

  

 Thank you for taking the time to apply! We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

**About Ramboll**
 Founded in Denmark, Ramboll is a foundation-owned people company. We have more than 18,000 experts working across our global operations in 35 countries. Our experts are leaders in their fields, developing and delivering innovative solutions in diverse markets including Buildings, Transport, Planning & Urban Design, Water, Environment & Health, Energy, and Management Consulting. We invite you to contribute to a more sustainable future working in an open, collaborative, and empowering company. Combining local experience with global knowledge, we together shape the societies of tomorrow
   

  

**Equality, diversity, and inclusion is at the heart of what we do**
 We believe in the strength of diversity and know that unique experiences and perspectives are vital for creating truly sustainable societies. Therefore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and supportive work environment where everyone can flourish and reach their potential. We welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds and encourage you to contact our recruitment team to discuss any accommodations you need during the application process.

title: Cisco Collaboration Engineer
description:
Position Summary:
   

  

 The Cisco Collaboration Engineer’s role within IT Service Delivery is to plan, design, build, install, configure, manage, secure, document, and support the systems within Data Center, Distribution Center, Public and Private Cloud environments, providing resilient, and scalable IT Services to support a fast-growing company.
   

  

 This role will be focused on the Cisco voice infrastructure, and will be responsible for developing, implementing, and documenting best practices and standards aimed at optimizing the VOIP infrastructure. The Collaboration Engineer will provide technical expertise, with ability to work on multiple projects and issues simultaneously, focusing on operational excellence and continuous improvement activities for Global IT Operations through ITIL based IT Service Management processes and procedures.
   

  

 The successful candidate must have excellent customer service, written, and verbal communication skills, and must be able to work collaboratively across multiple departments, business partners, and suppliers to meet operational performance and reliability targets. This role is critical in ensuring we collectively achieve our IT collaboration strategy: Enabling business & employee success through IT services that anticipate demand and simply work, anywhere, anytime.
   

  

 Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:
   

  

* Provide end to end ownership and accountability for the service delivery, maintenance, and support of the global VOIP infrastructure of Client, and performance of the managed service provider(s).
* Managing telephony migrations from on-premise CUCM into Cisco Cloud (Webex Calling).
* Design, build, manage, optimize, support, and maintain the Client Holdings global enterprise VOIP environment including, but not limited to: CUCM, SIP CUBE, Webex Calling and Contact Center.
* Based on industry-best standards, develop and maintain technical standards and system configuration documentation, physical and logical diagrams, knowledge base articles, and runbooks for the proper transition of services to external managed service providers.
* Responsible for software and hardware upgrades relating to the Cisco voice infrastructure, including EOL/EOS refresh as part of life cycle management, ongoing security patching and vulnerability remediation according to established standards.
* Proactively and reactively identify and remediate voice and video performance issues and act as escalation point to review and resolve technical issues through completion, including root cause analysis and corrective actions.
* Provide Tier 3 technical expertise and support relating to Cisco voice infrastructure, and act as escalation point for the IT Service Center to review and resolve technical issues through completion, including root cause analysis and corrective actions.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to provide operational support as needed, which may include off hours.
* Adhere to and participate in the current and future IT Service Management processes including, but not limited to incident, problem, and change control procedures.
* Other projects or duties as assigned.


 Required Skills and Experience:
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in any field and 1+ years working experience and proficiency with planning, designing, supporting, maintaining, and LAN/WAN/VoIP communications, network hardware such as Cisco routers, Ethernet switches, access points voice gateways & firewalls.
* OR 3+ years of on-the-job experience in these areas in lieu of bachelor’s degree.
* Experience with supporting technologies such as Cisco Voice technologies to include the following: Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM), Cisco Unity Connection (CUC), Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (CUCCX), Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence, and Cisco Unified Border Element (CUBE), Cisco Expressway, Cisco Video System, and Webex Control Hub and suite.
* Experience with Voice related protocols (SIP, RTP/SRTP, SDP, MGCP, SCCP etc.); SIP/PSTN Design and Voice Gateway Configuration. Detailed knowledge and understanding of telephony/UC protocols, H323, SIP, T38, TLS and Codecs
* Familiar with technology such as: Wireless (WiFi) 802.11 a/b/g/n technologies, Network security/VPN/SSL technologies, such as Cisco, Palo Alto, Cisco Nexus platforms
* Knowledge of network architecture and maintenance, such as log analysis, backup/recovery, high availability, capacity planning, and DR/resiliency.
* Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong technical support, problem solving, and critical thinking skills.
* Ability to collaborate effectively across teams in a high performing and matrixed team environment.


 Additional information
   

  

 The minimum gross wage according to the collective agreement (chemical industry) for your new job is EUR 3.909,67. We strive to adapt your salary to your range of tasks and to your profile, which is why we are ready to pay wages higher than collectively agreed. This is a legal requirement in Austria which is not applicable for other sites.

title: Är du vår nästa Analytics Consultant?
description:
Vi letar nu efter fler kollegor till vår växande grupp datakonsulter; personer som gillar att skapa magi genom data & analys!
   

  

 Våra närmare 200 dataexperter jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier, både med och utan cloud. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

 Såhär beskriver vår Viz-konsult Alexandra sitt nuvarande projekt:
   

  

 “Jag hjälper kunden att utveckla en app för att följa upp kostnader i stora projekt, för att se till att man ligger i linje med budgeten och fakturerar enligt plan. Mitt uppdrag hos kunden kommer att breddas framöver då jag nyligen hjälpt till att göra en kartläggning av Power BI-behov i hela verksamheten. Vi har bland annat hittat behov inom kvalitet och hållbarhetsredovisning – vilket jag tycker är extra spännande då det knyter an till mitt intresse för området. Det bästa med uppdraget är samarbetet – jag är del av ett Scrum-team bestående av bolagets egna it-medarbetare och användare. Det är också tryggt att ha Solitas community i ryggen, jag vet att jag aldrig är ensam, det finns alltid hjälp att få av kollegorna”
   

  

**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
* Du diskuterar gärna datavisualiseringar och databaser, och bygger inspirerande dashboards
* Du kan implementera datalösningar som fungerar både för dataexperter och beslutsfattare på företag
* Du lär dig gärna nya teknologier och metoder
* Du är bekant med och/eller är nyfiken på teknologier som Tableau, Power BI och SQL


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på. Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, och vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete, och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

**På Solita Får Du**
* Projekt som skapar riktiga avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället
* Nya teknologier
* En arbetskultur med hög självständighet och tillit
* Variation: i projekt, i teknologier, i angreppsätt
* Personlig utveckling och möjligheten att lära sig både från erfarna experter och våra interna utbildningssatsningar och communities
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med bl.a. 30 semesterdagar, fredagsfrukostar, aw:s, bike leasing, inhouse coach, yoga på kontoret, och pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet


 Blev du nyfiken? Hör av dig till oss!
   

  

***Solita är ett nordiskt företag som jobbar med digital transformation, styrd av data och mänsklig expertis. Vi har kontor i Sverige, Finland, Tyskland, Estland, Belgien och Danmark.***

title: SharePoint Developer to Bravero
description:
Do you have previous experience with SharePoint Online and want to take the next step in your career? Do you want to be part of a growing consulting company where your expertise is the key to success? Take the opportunity to work on exciting projects and become a key player in Bravero's continued expansion. Apply today – we conduct ongoing selections!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Bravero AB
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Immediately
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Bravero AB is a leading player in consultation and expertise for Microsoft 365 and Azure solutions. They aim for long-term client partnerships and focus on delivering quality and innovation. Bravero is now expanding its operations and is looking for a
   

**dedicated developer**
 to strengthen the consulting team.
 


  


 As a consultant, you will work closely with Bravero's clients to
   

**develop and improve their digital solutions**
 using SharePoint Framework (SPFx) and components in Azure. You will play an important role in identifying and solving technical issues and
   

**providing advice, support and recommendations to optimize functionality.**
 In the consulting role, it is important to have
   

**strong social skills**
 and be able to engage in dialogues with clients. You will work closely with clients, alongside your Bravero colleagues, and if interested, you can also take on a sales-supporting role. Bravero is a small consulting company in expansion, so you are expected to contribute to further developing their offerings and the shared expertise within the developer group. Here, you’ll be given much freedom with responsibility and great access to each other's expertise –
   

**Welcome to the Bravero family!**



  

  

**You are offered**
  

  
* Engaged and supportive leadership
  
* Centrally located office in Stockholm
  
* Exciting projects and development opportunities with Bravero's owns clients
  
* Attractive employee benefits, including profit-sharing
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* you with extensive knowledge of the Microsoft 365 platform
  
* you with experience developing in SharePoint Online with SharePoint Framework (SPFx) and React/TypeScript
  
* you with a strong interest in new technology and enjoys exploring new functionality within Microsoft’s cloud platforms
  


  


  

**It is preferred if you**



  

  
* speak fluent Swedish, as many clients use Swedish as their working language
  
* have previous experience in a consulting role where you’ve engaged in requirements and solution dialogues with clients
  
* have experience with PowerShell, APIs, C# .NET, and integrations
  


  


 To succeed in this role, you must have strong problem-solving skills, enjoy working in a team, and communicate effectively with technical and non-technical people. You are quality-conscious, paying attention to your product while also possessing a good business understanding. Does this sound like you? Feel free to apply today!
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Bravero AB**

 Read more about Bravero here!
   




**Get directly recruited to Bravero AB**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Elin Sjösten or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth3@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106766

title: Senior Test Automation Engineer (12mth FTC) | Farm Heroes Saga
description:
**Craft:**
**Job Description:**
****Job Description:****
 Farm Heroes Saga is now looking for an Senior Test Automation Engineer to join us in pivoting the future of game testing! This is a fixed term assignment aimed to be for a year. Join a team with a mission to build, innovate and build the foundation of Farm Heroes Saga and its content. You’ll be in the forefront of automation, seamlessly covering frontend, backend, and mobile clients. Together with the team, you will follow the lifecycle of the project to identify areas where automation can be used in order to improve.
   

  

 We are a small, dynamic team of detail oriented experts, with the ownership to make a difference. Join us in proactively adapting processes and automation solutions, to make sure that we perform at our peak. We are looking for a new team member, eager to take ownership and tackle technical challenges. You’ll be a key contributor in technical discussions together with the development team, and cross functional teams across King, with a culture of knowledge sharing in order to excel together.
   

  

 As a Senior member in this space, you'll shape the implementation of test processes and define workflows that enhance our testing capabilities. Stay ahead of the curve by evaluating and implementing the latest tools and technologies. Your impact isn't confined to code; you'll lead, coach, and inspire teammates, guiding feature development.
   

  

 If you're passionate about reshaping game testing through automation, we invite you to be a driving force in this transformative journey. Join us in elevating our testing capabilities and ensuring unparalleled quality assurance.
   

  

****Skills to create thrills****
* Experience in end-to-end test automation for mobile games, applications and other testing strategies, using tools like Applium
* Experience programming in Java, with exposure to C++, Python, and Database languages
* Experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins (job DSL and pipeline)
* Experience in improving test workflows via automation (Github and Slack integrations, notifications and alerts)
* Habit of collaborating with the team's developers and cross-collaboration with dev teams


****Tasty bonus skills****
* Experience developing and maintaining automation on cloud platform like GCP
* Experience working with cloud testing services like Perfecto or SauceLabs
* Familiarity with build tools like CMake and Gradle
* Experience with logging and monitoring tools like Splunk, Graylog and Grafana
* Experience with one of the automation test tools: Cypress, JEST or Puppeteer


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Senior Software Engineer (R-16681)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,500+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

 We are now recruiting for the Tech Lead for team Nasty Hamsters (4 Developers) in our Development Unit, a common component for the company which provides authentication and supporting services in Sweden. Team Nasty Hamsters is responsible of the common login solution. The team mainly work with backend development and also have some front-end applications as well.
   

  

 As a Tech Lead, you work with development together with the team and in addition to that motivate team members and give them feedback. You will help the team make decisions, as well as guide them in technical difficulties. The Tech Lead is responsible for decisions regarding choices of technique, architecture and design and to make sure it is in line with the overall directives. The Tech Lead also initiates and represent the team in discussions with other parts of the company as well as externally and ensures that the team is aligned with the development and agile process.
   

  

 The Tech lead will also discuss requirements with customers and help them understand the common component and products.
   

  

**Essential Key Responsibilities**
* Front end, back end designing and coding. Architecting the service and system with the help of architecture team. Maintain and enhance the product common login. Design new supporting service for common login - a collection of vendor solutions and custom application code that provides automated user registration, provisioning, authentication, access governance which requires special skills to underline architecture and login mechanism like oauth2 access token, refresh token and different authentication flow like code, implicit flow.
* Lead the Dev team in its daily work, including stand-ups and demos. Decide on techniques, architecture and design to be used and ensure that it is aligned with the overall IT directives. Addition to this lead should also develop and maintain RESTful APIs web services and front end application to enable seamless communication between the frontend and backend systems and various services.
* Communicate, educate, and enforce best practices and standards based on our guidelines. Responsible for sync between product teams. Represents the development team in dialogs with representatives of other functions. Create detailed design documentation


**Education/Experience And Competencies**
* Experienced full stack java developer with experience from working in microservices environment with continuous deployment and with IMS (identity management system) technologies. Extensive experience from working with some of our technical tools including Java, Spring, Microservices/Spring boot REST APIs, Kafka, Cassandra, AWS and Kubernetes. Preferably also some experience from Spring Boot, Elastic Search, RabbitMQ and Angular. Must have Working experience in Oauth2, access token, code and implicit flow, user management, SSO (single sign on). Knowledge in one of the cloud platforms like AWS/Azure/GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud deployment. Experience in Maven, Gradle, Git, Bamboo,Bitbucket and Databases: MySQL, No SQL(Cassandra), PostgreSQL
* Other Tools: Kibana, Grafana, Logstash, ELK, Kubernetes.
* Good to have: Frontend technology: working experience like angular, html, css, typescript, javascript, node, Testing: JUnit, Mockito, Rest Assured, Cucumber, WireMock, jasmine
* Extensive experience in designing, developing, deploying and operating large-scale stream processing workflows.
* Experience from working with IMS(Identity management system) and with deep knowledge of its architecture and functionality.
* Experience from working with Oauth2, microservices and with good understanding of databases.
* Extensive experience and fluency in working with NoSQL and columnar data stores.
* Experience from working with the Target Runtime environment and related technologies.
* Good understanding of modern machine learning technologies and familiarity with Python and frontend language like angular.
* Previous experience from working in a similar role.
* An academic degree in one of the following areas Engineering/Computer science/Information systems.
* Problem-solver with a positive attitude and experience of managing and working with stakeholders.
* Team player, responsible and structured.
* Great communicator and good people skills.
* Full professional proficiency in English.


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: Oracle HCM Lead for the Nordic Region
description:
Location: Sweden, Stockholm
   

  

 Do you have an eye on Human Resources and a heart that beats for technology?
   

  

 Are you ready to take your career to the next level and lead our Oracle HCM practice in the vibrant Nordic region?
   

  

 We are seeking a dynamic and motivated professional to join our team as the Oracle HCM Lead. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in shaping and driving the Oracle HCM practice, bringing innovative solutions to our clients, and contributing to the growth of our organization. If you are passionate about Oracle HCM, possess strong leadership skills, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Accenture is Oracle's largest global partner, and the team you'll be part of is made up of both early-stage professionals and global experts who have spent their entire careers on Oracle.
   

  

**As the Oracle HCM Lead for the Nordic Region, you will:**
- Provide strategic direction for the Oracle HCM practice, aligning with organizational goals and client needs.

- Lead client interactions, understanding their business requirements, and delivering tailored Oracle HCM solutions.

- Oversee end-to-end project delivery, ensuring timelines, budgets, and quality standards are met.

- Foster a collaborative team environment, mentoring and guiding team members to achieve excellence.

- Stay abreast of industry trends, bring fresh ideas, and champion innovative approaches to Oracle HCM implementation.

**We are looking for someone who:**
- Minimum of 7 years of hands-on experience leading Oracle HCM projects.

- In-depth knowledge of Oracle HCM Cloud modules and a successful track record of implementation.

- Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a team, driving successful project outcomes.

- Strong client management skills with the ability to understand and address client needs effectively.

- Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal.

- Relevant Oracle HCM certifications will be a strong advantage.

- Proven ability to analyze complex problems and provide innovative solutions.

- Understanding of the business landscape and cultural nuances in the Nordic region is a plus.

**We offer you:**
- Work with varied and interesting customers. One of Accenture's strengths is our broad client portfolio, which includes many of our leading companies in a wide range of industries.

- We put a lot of focus on both building knowledge within Oracle, but also general knowledge that is required to be able to help our customers and deliver successful projects.

- Our employee wellbeing is a highly valued topic for us. We find solutions to get the puzzle of life together with family & work.

 If you are ready to make a significant impact, lead with passion, and contribute to the success of our Oracle HCM practice in the Nordic region, we invite you to apply and submit your CV and cover letter. Join us in creating transformative experiences for our clients and unlocking the full potential of Oracle HCM solutions!

title: Senior Python Backend Engineer, Authentication
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for an experienced Python Backend Engineer to join our growing Authentication team! This team helps other Wolt Product teams to succeed - we embrace a customer-first mindset for creating tools, services, and sharing knowledge, in the domains of authentication and authorization and event-driven architecture.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer in the Authentication Team, your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain the Wolt Authentication component, which we've built from the ground up. This role is crucial for ensuring the security, reliability, and scalability of our platform, especially as our user base continues to grow rapidly.
   

  

 It’s a central role in the organization, you’ll work with multiple teams to secure our consumer applications, internal tools, as well as communication within our systems. You will be developing systems and libraries that are used across the platform, and you can have a big impact on the future development of these solutions.
   

  

 If you didn't know it yet, we have a strong Python community at Wolt: around 100 of our engineers are actively using Python and sharing knowledge related to its rich ecosystem. Wolt Tech Talks Youtube channel has recordings from our Python meetups and interesting articles in our engineering blog
   

  

 📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki and Stockholm. Read more about our hybrid and remote setup here.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 Our humble expectations:
   

  

 👉 You might be the one if you are an engineer with experience in designing and building top-class software and APIs with modern Python. We mostly work with Flask & FastAPI, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and appreciate it if you understand what it takes to build and operate scalable software services in production. Our massive backend is powered with Kubernetes in AWS so proficiency in these platforms or similar and cloud infrastructure is a huge plus. Experience with Go, Java, and related languages is seen as beneficial, and we also value previous front-end development exposure.
   

  

 👉 You know what it takes to achieve ambitious goals together. We expect you to be a good communicator, willing to collaborate with people outside of your own team, be a product-oriented and proactive problem solver willing to bring up issues in a constructive manner to the team and the Wolt Product team at large.
   

  

 👉 Understanding of security concerns in web applications such as SSO, Oauth, OpenID Connect, IAM, JWT, HTTP, and REST will also be a big plus, but don't let it get into your way if these are newer things for you, we are sure you'll get the grasp of them!
   

  

**Next Steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Fernanda (fernanda.prado.e.silva@wolt.com).
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**Working in Product Development at Wolt**
 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Staff Engineer, Systems Design
description:

Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**


Are you ready to join a team that is dedicated to developing flawless allergy and autoimmune solutions? Do you have a proven track record as a System Engineer in ambitious development projects? If so, Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. has an outstanding opportunity for you as a Staff Engineer, Systems Design, based in Uppsala.


As a Staff Engineer in our team, you will play a pivotal role in the entire development process, from the initial concept phase through to final testing. You will be responsible for initiating and driving development work to meet the needs of our customers and regulatory requirements. You will engage in various technical areas, including hardware, electronics, software, and robotics. Collaboration is key, as you will be part of a multi-functional project team striving for world-class solutions.


This is an outstanding opportunity to bring to bear your technical expertise while growing within one of the world's largest life-science companies.


How will you make an impact?

* Bachelor’s and/or Master’s (preferred) degree in a relevant engineering field, or equivalent experience.
* Proven experience in development projects, preferably within life sciences or other regulated industries.
* Expertise in system engineering tasks such as writing requirements, system architecture, concept development, and risk analysis.
* Experience with complex products involving hardware, electronics, software, and robotics.


How will you get there?

* A well-organized and collaborative standout colleague with excellent communication skills.
* Initiative-taker who works methodically within project teams.
* Clear communicator, both verbally and in writing, in English (Swedish is an advantage).
