title: Factory System Test Lead
description:
**Description**


At Hitachi Energy, we are a leading innovator in HVDC installations, dedicated to delivering exceptional solutions and services to our clients worldwide. With a presence in over 200+ countries, our diverse team of professionals is committed to excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement. We are proud of our rich history of success and our forward-looking approach that keeps us at the forefront of this industry.


We are now seeking a dynamic and driven Factory System Test Lead to join our professional team. If you are passionate about HVDC technology, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and eager to make a significant impact, we want to hear from you!


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements.

**Your responsibilities**

* Responsible for developing test strategies
* Manage the planning and execution of testing activities
* You will perform quality control and assurance
* You will have team management
* You will ensure compliance and standards
* Living Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business

**Your background**

* A bachelor's degree in STEM fields is essential
* You have knowledge of software tools and programming languages used in control systems PLC, SCADA, DCS
* It is an advantage if you have understanding of protection principles, relay coordination, and fault analysis in HVDC systems or equivalents
* You have excellent verbal communication skills that will allow you to report effectively and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders
* Proficient in both English and Swedish, with speaking and writing skills in both languages

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement.
* Flexible working time.
* Health care and wellness allowance.
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally.
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase.
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development.
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden.
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave.
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks.
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role.

**More about us**


Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!  

  

Recruiting Manager, Niklas Andersson, niklas.a.andersson@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29-86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Ingrid Schjelderup ingrid.schjelderup@hitachienergy.com.

title: Senior system Integration and Verification Engineer
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*

Your role


The person we are looking for will primarily be a part of our Giraffe AMB and Arthur Integration and Verification team. Today we are 13 people working with integration and verification of our projects, and customer releases as well as demos to potential customers and supporting integration of our product into system solutions. The work is both in a laboratory environment as well as in field with the complete sensor system.


An important factor is feedback and communication. To find recommendations and modification to improve performance. A key to ensure a robust product that fulfills our customers needs.


You will work closely with project management and system responsible to set expectations and meet deadlines. You will also work closely with engineering teams to build solutions to meet client needs. Your role covers analyzing requirements and design verification tests and perform formal verification and acceptance test together with our customer. You will also assist installation and service activities at our customer.


Your profile


Integration of complex systems covers a lot of expertise and a variation of competences.


If you want take on this job you have a couple of years experience in a relevant field. An education within software, electronics, mechatronics and/or computer engineering is preferred. You can plan and lead integration. It is beneficial if you are familiar with communication networks and computer platforms. A bit of practical experience of hardware for trucks, support systems and computers are preferred. Drivers license (B) is required.


You like to work in teams and solve complex problems with others. You have a personal need of variation and see it as a challenge to face new problems. There will be travelling to our customers in this role so you need to be communicative in text and speech for both Swedish and English.


This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.


What you will be a part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here


The department consists of 60 system Integration and Verification Engineers with experiences from most of our surface based products. They have a variety of competences and cooperation is a key to success.


Observe that you can send us your application in either Swedish or English.


Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: ML System Integration and Test engineer
description:
**We are looking for an experienced software/hardware engineer with a strong analytical approach to join the team and help ensure the best performance and quality with most recent Machine Learning (ML) software, systems and IP. The team covers a wide range of software and hardware levels, application domains, workloads and types of analysis to get a full and accurate picture of ML performance capabilities, limitations and improvement opportunities.**


### **Assignment Description**


* In this position you’re expected to develop test infrastructure for our fully automated test flow, including functional and performance testing, as well as visualization and report generation of the results.
* We collaborate closely with other specialists, including software, IP, and Systems teams to understand, explore and challenge the limits of performance capabilities.


**Requirements**


* You have strong python skills + professional experience.
* You have experience working with SW development or automated testing.
* You have a passion for analysis and improvements.
* You have a high level of pro-activity, initiative and problem-solving skills. as well as willingness to take on varied technical challenges.
* You have strong communication skills, inter-cultural awareness and you embrace diversity.
* Knowledge about working with pre-silicon platforms, building test infrastructure, low level debugging, or some familiarity with data analysis.

title: Systems Engineer at Electromobility
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**About the team:**


You will be part of a newly created team for sub systems engineering within the areas of charging and electric power take off. The team will work to define concepts and set requirements for the full Volvo Group platform of commercial electrical vehicles. As a part of Volvo's rapidly expanding Electromobility organization situated in the vibrant atmosphere of CampX, you will collaborate with innovative and solution-driven individuals both within and across teams.


Are you excited and intrigued by this opportunity? We encourage you to submit your application today and take the next step in your career!

 **About the role:**


In this role, you will be involved in various key aspects, starting from early concept development, moving on to defining requirements, and ensuring the sub system undergoes successful verification. Cross-functional leadership and networking skills are central parts for the role along with the ability to balance requirements across production, aftermarket, and customer needs.


This is an exciting opportunity where you will define the future of charging and electric power take off sub systems and contribute to the success of our company in the transition to zero emission commercial vehicles.

 **As Systems Engineer you will also:**


Contribute to the future roadmap of Charging and ePTO.  

Develop and enhance technical requirements to optimize system performance and features through continuous improvement initiatives.  

Manage requirements using tools like SystemWeaver.  

Collaborate with internal and external teams in a cross-functional manner.  

Take part of and follow standardization initiatives in the areas of charging and electric power take off.

 **We are looking for…**  

A driven team player with extensive experience from software and electronic systems development. Experience in a dynamic and high paced product development environment is beneficial. You will play a key role in making our battery electrical vehicle more profitable for our customers than conventional drivelines.


To excel in this role, you should possess an analytical mindset, adept problem-solving skills, and a keen interest in acquiring new technical knowledge. The position requires the ability to impartially balance diverse stakeholder requirements while taking ownership of the final product. Effective communication skills and strong networking abilities are essential for achieving success in this role.

 **Requirements:**

  

* You have M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Physics or Computer Science, Mechatronic or similar.
* 5 years of experience in working with systems design preferably within the automotive industry.
* Experience from working in an Agile development environment.
* Technical knowledge in the Electromobility products, systems, and components.
* Experience from working in requirements management tools.
* Good understanding of Autosar and SAE J1939 CAN based architectures.
* Fluent in both written and verbal English.

 **Desired qualifications may include:**

* Possession of a commercial driving license (C/CE for heavy-duty trucks or D for buses).
* Background in charging system or electrical power take-off in the automotive industry.
* Previous involvement in system engineering or product development at Volvo Group.
* Experience in system verification processes.
* Proficiency in System-FMEA (Failure Modes and Effects Analysis).
* Knowledge in Functional Safety (FuSA) and Cybersecurity.
* Experience in System weaver or SE tool requirement management tools.

 **Last Application Date**: 30 September, 2024

**Hiring manager:** Andreas Melin  

E-mail address: andreas.melin.4@volvo.com

 **Talent Acquisition Partner:** Dania Khairallah

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
Who we are:  

  

At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.  

  

To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.  

  

What you’ll do:
We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
The Senior Mechanical Engineer is responsible for program level designs and prototype fabrication of the hardware portion on our FDA Class II registered AAC devices. The senior mechanical engineer utilizes a 3D CAD platform (SolidWorks), which includes solid modeling, assembly modeling, and 2D drawing development to meet the program requirements and needs of our device users. The senior mechanical engineer also is responsible for management and execution of the development programs within the hardware product development group. This includes but is not limited to estimating project timing, program schedule management, overall program scope and execution.  

The senior mechanical engineer with collaborate with other mechanical engineers, industrial designers, electrical engineers, product managers, project managers, support staff, as well as our manufacturing group in China to ensure program design activities, goals and targets are completed on-time, on budget, to ensure a successful product. A key emphasis is the ability to contribute to a fast-paced development team to bring engineering solutions from concept through production to give our customers a voice utilizing our AAC devices.  

Responsibilities and Accountabilities:* Conceptual and detailed design of molded components (plastic and metal), sheet metal and machined components.
* Generate solid models, assemblies, and drawings utilizing SoldWorks.
* Develop innovative solutions that support the project requirements.
* Work as part of a team of mechanical and manufacturing engineering staff to bring projects through prototyping and into production launch.
* Perform and present gated design reviews with both internal staff and external vendors at specific times in the design life cycle of an AAC device. - Participate in the ECO process and support change management.
* Develop BOMs and part numbers in our Master Control system.


Who we are looking for:
Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering and 5-10+ years relevant work experience developing complex plastic/metal injection molded components that can be tooled and molded. Computer hardware development experience preferred.  

Required Skills and Education:* Experience with detail part/assembly/drawing development is required
* Experience with design for manufacturablity and assembly is required
* Proficient utilizing SolidWork 2019 or later
* Proficient in complex 3D solid and surface modeling (Solid Works) required.
* All Microsoft Office software and Teams
* Great problem solving and communication skills
* Experience being part of a high-performance team in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to maintain a safe working environment

  

Preferred Skills and Education:* Background in FDA registered Class II medical devices
* An understanding of ISO 13485 standards
* Experience in SolidWorks EPDM data management and software upgrades
* A SolidWorks certification is preferred
* Experience with AAC devices
* Experience with Master Control
* Plastic injection molding tool development
* Collaborating with a world-wide team (USA, China, Sweden)

  

Next step!
Please address your questions to Mikaela Nilsson (mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com) and submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through our website. Please submit your resume and application in English. We're looking forward to your application!  

Where we stand:  

We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.  

Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled
company_description: Tobii Dynavox’s mission is to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did, or never thought possible.

title: Software Test Engineer within Automotive
description:
**Company Description**  

Are you looking for a company that offers a variety of assignments and gives you the chance to work with innovation and new technologies? With us at SEGULA Technologies, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects and help shape the digital domain while being supported towards your dream career. Skills development is a big part of SEGULA Technologies' DNA and we are always looking for new, ingenious and bold talents. Does this sound exciting? Join us on our journey in a fast growing international company.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Software Test Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be instrumental in ensuring the quality and reliability of our systems through comprehensive testing and fault analysis. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and execute test cases, coordinate test activities, and provide critical feedback on test results. If you have a passion for problem-solving and a keen eye for detail, we want to hear from you!


In this role, you will be responsible for developing test methods and creating test cases using SystemWeaver and vTestStudio, ensuring all work is delivered according to specified criteria and definitions. Your duties will include writing test requirements, planning, and coordinating test activities in collaboration with the team. Additionally, you will create fault reports and assign them to the appropriate recipients to facilitate investigations and resolutions. You will also review and communicate supplier test reports and results, providing clear feedback and recommendations. Moreover, you will independently perform fault tracing, logging, and measurements on components, actuators, and signals.

 **Qualifications**  

* Experience with automotive test tools such as CANoe, CANalyzer,
* Strong experience in automotive diagnostics, familiarity with diagnostic protocol UDS (Unified Diagnostic Services).
* Strong understanding of communication protocols such as CAN, LIN and Ethernet
* Knowledge about safety critical systems and standards, such as ISO26262
* Experience in developing and maintaining automated test scripts using languages like Python, C/C++, or CAPL.
* Valid Swedish Driving license
* Excellent English language communication skills (both written and spoken)
* Knowledge with ISO21434 is highly meritorious!
* Deeper knowledge in the different ASPICE layers are highly meritorious.

 **Additional Information**  

To thrive in this role we believe that you enjoy working collaboratively and that you are proactive in taking initiative. To apply for this position, you need to have a valid work VISA within the European Union. We embrace diversity and equality and attach great importance to your personal qualities. We are continuously recruiting, so welcome with you application today!  

  

*For questions or further information, please contact talia.brorsson@segulagrp.com*
company_description: SEGULA is a gobal engineering group helping boost competitiveness within all of the major industrial sectors.

title: Functional Safety Manager
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**


We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

  


**Functional Safety Manager**
=============================

  


**Want to join us on our exciting journey?**
--------------------------------------------


Volvo Cars is on an exciting journey, redefining the automotive experience by innovating to make people’s lives less complicated. We offer you a once-in-a-lifetime chance to make an impact in a company with unique opportunities to grow and make a true difference.


**Computing Infrastructure System**
-----------------------------------


At the department of Computing Infrastructure System we are building a high-performance computer-in-the-car architecture designed to host software-driven functions and features in our next generation pure electric and self-driving vehicles. Volvo Cars next generation cars will have centralized computing with a core system that serve as a platform for our stakeholders and partners to deploy applications on, instead of multiple electronic control units around the car to control individual features and systems. Our multi-node architecture includes high-performance and high-integrity systems on a chip (SoC), providing a safe and secure framework for current and future vehicles.


**What you will do**
--------------------


You will work as a System Safety Engineer and be part of a safety team responsible for System Safety Engineering of the core system. The work includes safety analysis and risk assessment of the defined system design, covering methodologies such as FTA, FMEA and FMEDA. It also includes defining the Technical Safety Concepts for the product and identifying Technical Safety Requirements. Compliance towards ISO 26262 and working according to Volvo Cars defined system safety processes is an obvious part of the responsibility. The role requires a lot of collaboration with colleagues in the team, with other teams within Core System Platform and other parts of R&D.

  


**Do you fit the profile?**
---------------------------


We believe that you are a highly skilled System Safety Engineer with several years of experience in safety for different types of systems and solutions. You are a genuine problem solver with a positive and solution-oriented mind-set. You are known to be a team player, you are curious and have a great ability to learn.


Competence requirements and required experience:


* Good knowledge of systems engineering including embedded SW/HW in the automotive domain.
* Good knowledge of system safety engineering practices, safety standards and product safety.
* Deep knowledge in the automotive relevant system safety standards e.g. (ISO 26262, ISO21448)
* Experience in risk assessment and analysis methodologies (HARA, FTA, FMEDA, FMEA) and processes/methods/tools for functional safety
* Experience in requirements management
* M.Sc. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent
* Very good in English, both written and spoken
* Flexible, enthusiastic, methodical, analytical, and with high professional integrity
* Self-motivated and able to drive initiatives
* Excellent collaboration skills

**Interest and application**
----------------------------


To apply, please register your profile at our career site and attach your application documents as soon as possible since recruitment is ongoing. Please note that applications by e-mail will not be accepted. As we use our own channels for recruitment, we respectfully but strictly decline to be contacted for any offer of recruitment assistance from external companies.


**About Volvo Cars**
--------------------


The future belongs to those who are empowered by a great idea and can carry it out. At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand" by simplifying people's lives. We have bold targets when it comes to innovation, sales and customer satisfaction and to make this happen, we need talented people onboard. People with passion, energy, business sense and the drive to innovate. People that want to create the next generation Volvo cars in a global, dynamic and respectful environment. We will support you to reach your full potential. Join us on this exciting journey into the future.

  


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**

Volvo Cars’ success is the outcome of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  



  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Make sure you’re in the front seat on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior Java Backend Developer to global company at Lindholmen

You will also play a key role in contributing to the solution design of our services and providing support to the developer community within the organization.

 A candidate with at least 3 years related work experience with competency in the following:

The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 Read more about Academic Work

 Sanam Talimy or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on gbg02@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106834

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
**Are you ready to take the next step in your career? At PwC, we believe in leveraging our different perspectives to jointly develop tomorrow's businesses and organizations. We share a common goal of contributing to something bigger than ourselves by building trust, making positive change, and creating long-term sustainable value. Are you ready to explore new career opportunities with us?**
**Become part of PwC's business support team**
 As an employee within PwC's business support, you have an important role in ensuring that the organization functions smoothly and efficiently and delivers value to our customers and stakeholders. Within business support, there are six units that work together to support the internal operations. We work with everything from communication, marketing, employees and , IT to finance, purchasing, risk management and quality assurance. By coordinating and collaborating across these different departments, the organization can benefit from our specialized knowledge to support and improve the business at large.
   

  

**Are you our new colleague in the business support team?**
 To thrive in this role, we envision that you excel in collaboration and enjoy building relationships with both colleagues and clients. You are naturally curious, adaptable, and find joy in solving problems, preferably within a team. Moreover, you are motivated by taking personal responsibility and achieving results. The opportunities for development are substantial, facilitated by our comprehensive training programs and collaboration within the teams you're part of. Strong communication skills are essential, and you thrive in working in diverse environments, as a significant portion of the daily work takes place at client locations
   

  

**Your Main Tasks As a Experienced Fullstack Developer**
* Using feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.
* Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities and coach to help deliver results.
* Develop new ideas and propose innovative solutions to the problems.
* Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.
* Share knowledge within the team and PWC.
* Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing others.
* Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality, diverse relationships.
* Support and mentor team members when needed.
* Be an essential part of the team, in addition to its culture and ways of working. Day-to-day practices include agile methodologies, pair and mob programming.


**Qualifications For The Position**
* C#/.NET
* Angular
* REST and Entity framework
* Javascript/Typescript
* SQL and cloud platforms (Azure)
* CI/CD pipelines
* Azure Devops Services or similar


 ,
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.
   

  

**Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application**
* CV


 We believe in the strength of having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection. The tests are the first step in our selection process. You will receive a link to these tests after we have received your application.
   

  

 We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - EY Tech.Collective
description:
At the EY Tech.Collective, you will be building tax and law software products for increased efficiency, quality, and joy.
   

  

 We help thousands of clients with services such as producing correct and compliant tax filings, and consulting multinational companies on how to navigate the international tax landscape.
   

  

 To do those jobs with the highest of degree of accuracy and efficiency, smooth processes and great software play key roles.
   

  

 We operate across the Nordics (DK, FI, SE, NO) with a small, flat, and informal organisation of ~30 engineers, designers, researchers, and PMs. In a distributed setup across all countries where we work from home and offices depending on preferences and needs.
   

  

 Tax? Yes, tax filings and tax law are the domains we design and build for, so having an interest in those areas would be good. Actual experience and domain knowledge is of course a plus, but certainly not a requirement. It’s a pretty small Venn diagram of senior engineers who also have professional tax experience.
   

  

 Above all, we value working with good all-round people. People who are both highly specialised but are capable collaborating across disciplines.
   

  

**About You**
 As a senior frontend engineer, you will be entrusted with crafting elegant and responsive user interfaces across several business-critical products.
   

  

 As a master of your craft, you will write beautiful and fast JS/TS and for both React apps. Code that is well-tested, documented, optimised for speed, and easy to maintain.
   

  

 You have honed those skills over the years by working on complex applications in cross-functional product teams, where you have shown yourself as a wonderful collaborator.
   

  

 You have likely also done many code reviews and taken initiative to question decisions made by people more senior in the company than yourself. And challenged product decisions that didn’t make sense to you.
   

  

 If that sounds like you, we should talk. In the meantime, here’s more information about the work and our team.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
* Solving complicated problems together with likeminded people.
* Close collaboration with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers.
* Spending time, occasionally, with users and user researchers to understand problems in detail.
* Working across a range of products and problem spaces.
* Freedom to work remotely or in our Copenhagen or Stockholm office.


**Skills And Attributes For Success**
 We are looking for a good coder and a great colleague. These are the most important things that should characterise you.
   

  

**To qualify for the role, you should have**
* A true love for software and a strong believes in how software can help people.
* Proficiency in modern JS frameworks such as React and have worked on multiple mission-critical applications.
* An eye for aesthetics and UI quality.
* A positive attitude towards Typescript and various test frameworks.
* Experience in working with service-based architectures.
* Experience with continuous deployment pipelines.
* Easy access to Copenhagen, Helsinki, or Stockholm. You can work remotely most of the time, but we meet up in person weekly.
* Really good English speaking and writing skills. That’s our work language.
* An interest in tax law.


**What We Look For**
 We obliviously want you to be a good coder, but we believe that a senior engineer is so much more than that. We are looking for a colleague who is…
   

  

* A real craftsperson and a stickler for details.
* Delightful to be around.
* A clear communicator.
* Supportive and helpful.
* Quick to solve problems.
* Questioning ideas and decisions before committing.
* Eager to learn.


**What We Offer**
* A tech product team: Tech Collective as a unit operates mostly product- and user-driven, even though we are situated within a large consultancy organisation.
* Direct access to users: Your work matters to people who are quite literally right next to you, for when you want direct feedback or input.
* Good food and good times: We take good care of the people who dedicate their working hours to our cause.
* Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


 To learn more about EY and what it’s like to work here, please follow us on EY Careers, Career blog and social media.
   

  

**Apply now**
 Please apply with your CV and Cover Letter. We review applications on a continuous basis so please apply right away, but no later than 30.9.2024. For questions regarding the role, do not hesitate to contact jess.olsen@dk.ey.com. For any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact helene.fife@dk.ey.com. We look forward to your application.
   

  

**The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.**
 At EY we celebrate differences and support it. Our employees bring their authentic selves to work every day. We promote diversity of thought, culture, and background, and are committed to creating an inclusive EY environment for all employees. EY is an equal opportunity employer for employees and applicants. EY encourages applications from all backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.
   

  

 If you need any support or adjustments during the recruitment process or the employment, please contact our local recruitment team at recruitment@se.ey.com. You do not need to disclose any details about your disability or reasons for needing adjustments. Simply let us know what kind of support or adjustment you require and how it will benefit you throughout the process. We are committed to ensuring a smooth and inclusive recruitment process for all candidates. Read more here.
   

  

**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
   

  

 Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Fullstack .NET/C# utvecklare
description:
**Bli en del av vårt team som vår första utvecklare - Fullstack .NET/C#** 




 Vi på Elcykelpunkten är stolta över att ha skapat en innovativ plattform för förmånscyklar som revolutionerar hur företag och deras anställda interagerar med förmånen. Nu söker vi en passionerad och erfaren utvecklare som kan vara med och ta vår plattform till nästa nivå.
 



  





**Om oss:** 
 Elcykelpunkten är ledande inom gröna transporter och elcyklar och har utvecklat en banbrytande plattform för att hantera förmånscyklar. Vår plattform integrerar fler tredjepartsprogram som Order management system Omnium, WMS Bitlog, CMS Contentful, och E-handelsmotorn Norce för att skapa en sömlös upplevelse för våra kunder. Utöver detta bygger vi även franchisekedja med 10+ butiker och har en traditionell e-handel som an del av vår verksamhet.
 



  





**Din roll:** 
 Som vår första utvecklare kommer du att vara ansvarig för att utveckla och underhålla integrationer mellan olika system samt skapa effektiva gränssnitt mellan kunder, personalavdelningar och våra interna processer. Du kommer att arbeta med både frontend och backend och behöver god förståelse för systemarkitektur och kodskrivning i C# och .NET. I rollen kommer du även koordinera samarbete med vår byrå för att säkerställa högsta möjliga framdrift i utvecklingsarbetet.
 



  





**Vi letar efter dig som:** 



* Har gedigen erfarenhet av fullstack-utveckling med fokus på .NET och C#.
* Kan arbeta självständigt och i team för att lösa komplexa problem.
* Har kunskap om integrationer mellan olika system och erfarenhet av att bygga gränssnitt.
* Har förståelse för systemarkitektur och kan bidra till att utveckla och förbättra vår plattforms tekniska grund.



**Det är meriterande om du:** 



* Har erfarenhet av headless e-handelsplattformar eller B2B e-handel.
* Har kunskap om molntjänster och moderna utvecklingsmetoder.



**Vi erbjuder:** 



* En spännande roll i ett snabbväxande företag med möjlighet att påverka och bidra till vår plattforms framtid.
* Ett dedikerat och passionerat team med fokus på innovation och kvalitet.
* Möjlighet till personlig utveckling och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling.
* Möjlighet att vara med och forma vår inhouse tech-avdelning då vi går från att jobba med externa team till att bygga upp vår egen tech-avdelning.



  





**Sök nu:** 
 Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och tror att du är rätt person för denna utmaning, skicka din ansökan redan idag. Vi ser fram emot att få lära känna dig och diskutera hur du kan bidra till vårt team och vår plattforms framgång!
 



  





 Start: Snarast
 



 Anställningsform: Tillsvidare
 



 Plats: Vi sitter i nya lokaler i Hammarby Sjöstad/Gullmarsplan i skrapan Sthlm01.

title: MATLAB MBD Developer
description:
We are seeking a talented MATLAB MBD Developer to join our team and work on cutting-edge automotive powertrain solutions. If you're passionate about model-based development with MATLAB/Simulink and have experience in optimizing code and implementing industry standards, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Migrate to a new MATLAB version and ensure MISRA C 2012 compliance.
* Develop and integrate new MATLAB features to meet ISO 26262 standards.
* Provide support and resolve critical warnings for MBD toolchain users.
* Develop features using MATLAB/Simulink and optimize generated C code.
* Conduct testing and ensure model functionality using Simulink.


**Requirements:**
* 4+ years of experience in MATLAB/Simulink MBD.
* Strong C programming skills.
* Experience with automotive standards, particularly in powertrain.
* Familiarity with MISRA C and ISO 26262 standards.
* Collaborative team player with a problem-solving mindset.


**Why Join Us?**
* Work on innovative automotive technologies.
* Dynamic environment with growth opportunities.
* Collaborate with industry experts.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. ClientsWorking with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Submit your resume and cover letter here. For questions, contact shivani@vipas.se

title: Data Center Engineer
description:
Är du en passionerad problemlösare med en djup förståelse för datacenterinfrastruktur och en vilja att ständigt utvecklas inom IT? Vi söker dig som vill definiera infrastruktur som kod, arbeta med virtualisering, och utforska containers och molnteknologier, allt medan du säkerställer att våra on-prem lösningar fungerar sömlöst.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 I tjänsten som Infrastructure Datacenter Engineer kommer du arbeta tillsammans med ett team i en modern IT-miljö. Du kommer att arbeta med att administrera och automatisera storskaliga system på vår interndrift. Vi söker efter dig som har arbetat med virtualisering och moderna lagringstekniker. Som Infrastructure Datacenter Engineer är det en självklarhet att definiera infrastruktur som kod för att underlätta din och andras vardag. Vi ser att du, precis som vi, vill lära dig om, och jobba mer med containers och molnet samtidigt som det behöver fungera med en on-prem lösning.
 



  





 Du kommer även att arbeta med:
 


* Drifta och ta ansvar i tekniker som DNS, IP, PTP/NTP och OpenShift
* Använda verktyg som Python, Linux, Puppet Foreman och Ansible
* Definiera och hantera infrastruktur som kod
* Hantera visualiseringslösningar som Openshift och Hypervisors.
* Arbeta med SAN, NAS och moderna lagringstekniker



  





 Du kommer att ingå i vårt Tooling-team om 7 personer som tillsammans ser till att vi alltid levererar stabila och säkra tjänster till våra kunder. Du kommer få möjlighet att utvecklas i ett engagerat team som ger dig mycket förtroende. Som team ansvarar man även för att tillhandahålla våra basinfrastrukturtjänster och att ständigt framtidssäkra vår IT-miljö.
 



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen som Infrastructure Datacenter Engineer hos oss bör du vara en nyfiken problemlösare med en passion för teknik och drivkraft att ständigt förbättra system. Ditt engagemang att vilja lära dig mer om och hålla dig uppdaterad kring de senaste teknikerna är viktigt för att du ska ta dig an nya utmaningar med entusiasm. Vidare söker vi dig med en analytisk förmåga som kommer att vara avgörande i rollen för att effektivt optimera våra system och identifiera komplexa tekniska utmaningar som kan uppstå i våra system.
 



  





 Vi ser gärna att du har:
 


* Goda kunskaper inom datacenterinfrastruktur inklusive serverhantering och nätverk.
* Djup förståelse av virtualiseringsplattformar som Openshift och Hypervisors.
* Kunskap i programmeringsverktyg som Puppet, Foreman och Ansible.
* Färdigheter inom moderna lagringstekniker som SAN och LAS.



  





 Du ska trivas i en dynamisk miljö där förändring och innovation är en del av vardagen. Du har förmågan att snabbt anpassa dig till nya situationer och möjligheter som uppstår. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats med mycket frihet att få pröva dina kunskaper på egen hand, men som även ser samarbetet med teamet som en värdefull del av ditt arbete. Vi tror på kraften i samarbete och kunskapsutbyte med kollegor för att tillsammans skapa framgångsrika projekt. Vi hoppas att du delar denna syn och vill bli en del av vårt tooling team.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök nu” under annonsen. Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast 18/8. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR. Kontakta gärna Björn Lindholm, Engineering Manager, på bjorn.lindholm@avanza.se om du har några frågor om tjänsten.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*

title: Functional Senior Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**About Us**
 With over 150 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team—accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As part of the Partner Bank Networks team, you will take a lead role in the development, operation, and evolution of Klarna’s integrations with partner banks. You will be responsible for:
   

  

* Leading the development and operation of systems that facilitate payments and collections.
* Maintaining stable integrations between Klarna and various banking partners.
* Proactively identifying and implementing improvements to system design and tooling for bank operations teams.
* Solving integration issues, handling exceptional cases, and ensuring smooth, scalable operations.
* Collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to ensure alignment and successful deliveries.
* Mentoring less experienced engineers and contributing to the overall growth of the team.


 You will play a crucial role in ensuring Klarna’s systems remain a reliable and unified interface between Klarna and its partner banks.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Proven experience with Erlang + OTP (Elixir experience is considered, but with a preference for switching to Erlang).
* Familiarity with Postgres, Kafka, and AWS is highly desirable.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to challenge the status quo and drive transformation within systems and processes.
* Strong communication skills, capable of efficiently collaborating with stakeholders and leading team projects.
* Experience working in complex environments with a focus on simplifying operations.
* A proactive leader with a passion for mentoring and driving team success.


**Awesome to Have**
* Experience building scalable, reliable payment and collection systems.
* Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure and tools like AWS.
* Python Knowledge


****Closing****
 Please include a CV in English.
   

  

 Since 2005 Klarna has been on a mission to revolutionize the retail banking industry. With over 150 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is meeting the changing demands of consumers by saving them time and money while helping them be informed and in control.
   

  

 Over 450,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store. Klarna has over 3,500 employees and is active in 45 markets.

title: Senior Safety Assurance Engineer
description:
Req ID: 462184
   

  

 At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.
   

  

 Could you be the full-time
 **Senior Safety Assurance Engineer** 
 in
 **Stockholm** 
 we’re looking for?
   

  

**Your future role**
 Take on a new challenge and apply your expertise and work alongside passionate, motivated, and dedicated teammates.
   

  

 You'll be responsible for managing, performing, and ensuring activities related to safety along the lifecycle of our products and subsystems and deliver safe solutions. Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business and certified specialists across technical domains – your tasks will be to coordinate all safety assurance activities on the project, system, or product as per the safety process defined in the Signalling Safety Instructions. You’ll undertake product safety assessments, manage Hazard Log, review RAM, Cybersecurity, validation activities from a safety perspective and much more.
   

  

 You’ll specifically take care of defining safety plan and manage safety workload and associated planning.
   

  

**We’ll look to you for:**
* Producing assessments and applying safety assurance methodologies (risk acceptance criteria, safety analysis, verification, and validation) defined for the project / system / product
* Providing cost and schedule estimates
* Producing documentation
* Sharing expertise with colleagues and other departments.


**All About You**
 We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:
   

  

* Degree in or passion for engineering
* Familiarity with industry standards, laws, and regulations (CENELEC Standards for Safety or equivalent standards if needed: AREMA, IEEE) and safety methodology, concepts, and principles
* On the job experience in in safety assurance, including some years in Railway business or other safety critical industry (automotive, medical, aerospace, etc.)
* Adaptability and a flair for time and task management
* Being productive, collaborative and receptive
* Exceptional communication skills
* Eagerness to share knowledge
* Ability to envision the bigger picture and the contribution this role makes to our success.


**Things you’ll enjoy**
 Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:
   

  

* Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
* Work with meaning, making a tangible impact
* Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
* Contribute to innovative projects
* Utilise our hybrid environment
* Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
* Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
* Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension).
* Become part of a great safety team


 You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Important to note**
 As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

title: Erfaren GPU/CUDA-utvecklare till Mycronic!
description:
Tänk dig de mest högteknologiska elektronikprodukterna du kan föreställa dig, och sen tänker du ett steg längre. Med världsledande produktionslösningar leder Mycronic elektronikindustrin och skapar nutidens mest högteknologiska produkter, men med en ödmjukhet inför att det viktigaste för att lyckas med detta är en passion för såväl affärer som teknik och framför allt människor. Mycronic befinner sig i en expansiv fas där de vill fortsätta etablera sig på fler marknader och i fler länder och för att göra detta söker de personer som vill vara med på deras fortsatta resa. Har du några års arbetslivserfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, vana av att arbeta hårdvarunära och vill vara med och tänja gränserna för vad GPU kan göra? Då har du kommit rätt!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Mycronic AB (publ)
 



  

**Plats :**
 Täby
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Mycronic är ett svenskt bolag som i över 40 år har utvecklat och tillverkat maskiner för elektronik- och displaytillverkning och de har idag kunder och distributörer i över 50 länder världen över. I dagsläget finns det inget annat företag i hela världen som kan konkurrera med Mycronics teknik och produkter. Alla skärmar med hög upplösning du ser, oavsett om det är TV, telefon, surfplatta, Apple Watch etc. så är de tillverkade med Mycronics maskiner och det är dessa som du kommer att vara en viktig del i utvecklingen av. Du kommer att befinna dig i den absoluta framkanten av elektronikindustrin och jobba i ett blandat team med både juniora och erfarna utvecklare inom såväl C++, Java och C. Utöver det samarbetar du i tvärdisciplinära projekt tillsammans med ingenjörer inom såväl elektronik, mekatronik, mekanik, optik och litografi och ni arbetar gemensamt för att ta fram de bästa lösningarna.
 


  


  

**Några ord från en av gruppcheferna inom mjukvara på Mycronic**



  


 “Hos oss kommer du möta utmaningar i den absoluta framkanten av dagens teknik inom området parallellbearbetning och GPU-accelererad beräkning. Mycronic har ett varmt, vänligt och innovativt företagsklimat med en inkluderande kultur och vi välkomnar gärna dig som vill vara en del av detta :)"
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En roll med stor frihet under ansvar och en möjlighet att verkligen göra skillnad med dina kunskaper inom utveckling och GPU.
  
* En möjlighet att arbeta med hela utvecklingskedjan från krav till koncept, utveckling och test.
  
* Hos Mycronic arbetar personer från olika delar av världen, i olika åldrar och med olika erfarenheter vilket är något som ses som en styrka. Här blir du en del av ett företag med en öppen företagskultur där man hjälper och tror på varandra och för Mycronic är mångfald inte bara en konkurrensfördel utan också en viktig pusselbit för en innovativ och givande arbetsmiljö.
  


  


  

**Bringing tomorrow's electronics to life.**



  

  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Divisionen PG (Pattern Generator) som du kommer att tillhöra har idag en mjukvaruorganisation om runt 60 medarbetare uppdelade på 7 team där du kommer att tillhöra ett av dem. Rollen som GPU Software Engineer är ny då GPU är ett relativt nytt område för Mycronic som man kommer att satsa mycket på framåt. Målet med detta är att kunna bearbeta data snabbare och på så sätt leverera ännu mer värde till deras kunder. Du kommer att vara en viktig del i arbetet med att maximera prestandan och säkerställa att ni får ut så mycket som möjligt av hårdvaran men också att göra produkten så användarvänlig som möjligt. Du kommer att jobba med hela utvecklingsprocessen från ax till limpa och samarbeta tätt med dina kollegor där dina idéer både kommer uppskattas och lyftas och tillsammans möjliggör ni morgondagens elektronikproduktion.
 


  


 Vidare kommer du att…
 


  

  
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att designa och implementera GPU
  
* Optimera befintlig programvara för GPU-arkitekturer för att maximera prestanda och effektivitet
  
* Göra research för att hitta nya tekniker inom GPU och hålla dig uppdaterad inom de senaste inom GPU-teknik och CUDA-programmering
  
* Genomföra kodgranskning, testning och felsökning
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och intresse för Mycronic som företag och denna specifika tjänst. Motivera väl i din ansökan varför du valt att söka.
 


  

  
* Har minst en kandidatexamen inom datateknik, elektronik eller liknande
  
* Flerårig erfarenhet inom området
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper inom CUDA-programmering och GPU-arkitektur
  
* Har förståelse för parallellprogrammering
  
* Har goda kunskaper inom C/C++
  


  


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har…
 


  

  
* Kunskaper inom OpenCL eller Vulkan
  
* Kunskaper inom TensorFlow eller PyTorch
  
* Kunskaper inom OpenGL, DirectX eller liknande
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Placering: Täby, möjlighet till ett par dagars distansarbete per vecka
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Johanna Sörell, Recruitment Consultant, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  
* Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Mycronics önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work.
  
* Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work + personlighetstest & problemlösningstest
  
* Intervjuer med Mycronic
  
* Referenstagning + beslut
  


  

  

  

  

  

**Mycronic AB (publ)**

 Läs mer om Mycronic på deras hemsida: https://www.mycronic.com/
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Mycronic AB (publ)**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johanna Sörell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn05@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105266

title: Konsultuppdrag | Sharepoint Developer/Specialist
description:
We are now looking for a Sharepoint Developer/Specialist to one of our amazing banking clients.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 01-okt-2024
   

**End date:** 
 31-dec-2024
   

**Location:** 
 Stockholm -  3 days onsite Solna
   





**Project and role description** 




 You will be part of a Product Team who are responsible for providing a set of digital collaboration tools used by over 15 000 colleagues in a global organization. We are on a cloud transformation journey to improve and modernizing their collaboration, information creation and sharing by implementing and driving adoption of M365 tools and specifically building SharePoint sites for different communication needs.
   

 You will design and build a good search experience for SharePoint Online content together with developers in clients Intranet team to fulfill a business need to improve an consolidate information search.
   

 Including work to analyze, design and develop a scalable solution to be used to further index relevant SharePoint Online content to Intranet search.
   





**Requirements:**
 • You have several years of experience working with SharePoint and OneDrive in a global organization.
   

 • You are senior expert and developer for SharePoint Online and have an in-depth technical experience of the different features, possibilities and boundaries within SharePoint, for it to be used to its full potential.
   

 • You are used to both designs, develop and implement solutions with SharePoint Online according to Microsoft best practices in global organizations.
   

 • You have deep knowledge in SharePoint Online and M365 search and know how to build integrations using App registrations including utilizing suitable APIs to gather and consolidate data.
   

 • Together with Intranet developers you will investigate, design and build a solution where SharePoint consolidated data will be captured and further indexed to Intranet search.
   

 • You appreciate an open and transparent environment where everyone’s opinion matters, and you enjoy cross team collaboration and value creation
 







**Language skills:**
 English & Swedish
 



  





  





**Om oss** 




**Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.
   

 Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.**
*Läs vidare på* 
*www.senterprise.se*

title: Data Engineers till Stockholm
description:
Data Engineer till Stockholm som vill lösa uppgifter genom modern teknik, tillsammans med ett stort nätverk Data- och Analysexperter.
   

  

*Är du en erfaren Dataingenjör, BI-utvecklare/BI-konsult eller ETL-utvecklare? Drömmer du om att fortsätta din professionella resa tillsammans med ett team kunniga kollegor? Motiveras du av att arbeta med moderna teknologier och lösa problem för kunder inom olika branscher kan DU vara vår nästa Dataingenjör!*
 På Solita handlar allt om att förbättra företag och forma en ljusare framtid genom att dra nytta av kraften av data i vår uppkopplade värld. Tänk dig detta: våra kunder sträcker sig över alla olika branscher och områden, vi finns överallt! Som ett sammanhållet team av IT-experter är vi för närvarande 1700 personer spridda över sex länder. I Sverige arbetar våra dataexperter med en stor och mångsidig projektpool där de bygger datamodeller, skapar innovativa dataplattformar och skapar molnbaserade datapipelines, samt mycket mer!
   

  

**Träffa en Solitan**
 Möt
 **Clara Lundström,** 
 en Data Engineer här på Solita. Hon arbetar i ett projekt för ett globalt företag inom facility service, det största i Norden. Clara, tillsammans med ett team av Solita-entusiaster, belyser datalandskapet och använder data från olika källor för att skapa visualiseringar. Erfaren med molnverktyg arbetar hon med data, automation och transformation.
   

  

*“Att arbeta som konsult på Solita är varierat samtidigt som du har tillgång till ett stort nätverk av experter inom många olika områden. Det ger utmärkta möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll, vare sig det handlar om att bredda dina kunskaper eller specialisera dig. Anledningen till att jag trivs så bra på Solita är den vänliga, stödjande och opretentiösa atmosfären.”*
**Hur är det att jobba på Solita?**
 Solitas företagskultur är annorlunda många andra företags, den handlar om autonomi, att stötta och växa tillsammans med våra kollegor samt att leva våra värdeord – passion, courage, easy-going och caring.
   

  

 Rent konkret innebär det ett företag som har genomtänkta interna tillväxtvägar, att det finns spännande kundprojekt och erfarna kollegor som är omtänksamma och passionerade. Du kommer också få chansen att arbeta med en stor bredd av projekt och branscher där du stöttar och hjälper kund med faktiska affärspåverkande beslut som lämnar avtryck och består. Utöver detta har vi även partnerskap med en mängd tech-företag såsom, GCP, AWS, Snowflake för att nämna några.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 På Solita värdesätter vi att du har erfarenhet av teknik och kommunikation på både svenska och engelska. Tekniska förmågor som ETL/ELT, python, SQL, DBT, Snowflake och verktyg inom orkestrering samt datamodellering och datawarehousing är något som ofta används i det dagliga arbetet. Våra kunder arbetar ofta i cloud-miljöer så kunskap i tekniker som Azure, GCP och AWS behövs. Om du kan något visualiseringsverktyg är även det ett plus i kanten, gärna PowerBI eller Tableau.
   

  

 Som konsult på Solita handlar arbetet inte bara om det tekniska – att kommunicera med kund i förklaring av tekniska lösningar, tolkande av deras behov och att hantera potentiella problem du kommer få hantera så vana med att kommunicera med stakeholders och kunder är en bra erafarenhet. Vi arbetar autonomt på Solita, så att vara van att diktera och planera upp sitt arbete självständigt behövs.
   

  

**En Dag På Solita**
 En dag på Solita kan ofta starta med ett standup-möte med kund och dina team-medlemmar, där ni stämmer av agendan för dagen för veckan. Sen kliver du in i ditt kodnära arbete: byggande av data pipelines, programmering i python/SQL, arbete med data och byggande i cloud. Under dagen kan det dyka upp ad-hoc möten med kund, kollegor som behöver stöttning eller helt enkelt att du lyssnar på våra interna utbildningsmöten; infosessions, som kan handla om allt relaterat till Solita och branschen. Dagen fortsätter ofta med det kod nära arbetet, möten med kollegor och kund och inte minst – fika!
   

  

 Du kan även ha interna projekt såsom att köra en dragning på vår Data Academy eller annat på din to-do list!
